document.docAuthor: Ferreira, Vinicius S. & Ivie, Michael A.
document.masterDocTitle: A Review of the Nearctic Genus Lucaina Dugès, 1879 (Coleoptera: Lycidae: Lycinae: Calochromini), with Descriptions of Two New Species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Review of the Nearctic Genus Lucaina Dugès, 1879 (Coleoptera: Lycidae: Lycinae: Calochromini), with Descriptions of Two New Species

bibRefCitation.author: Gorham, H. S.
bibRefCitation.refString: Gorham, H. S. 1884. Biologia Centrali-Americana, Insecta, Coleoptera, Supplement to Malacodermata v. 3, pt. 2. London, UK.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Lucaina marginata
can be identified among other
Lucaina
by the black elytra with yellow margins (some specimens may have the basal 1/5 of elytra yellow), a wide black longitudinal stripe on the pronotum (some specimens may have black spots only on disc) ( Fig. 2 ), the elongate rostrum and labrum ( Fig. 9 ), and the male genitalia parallel-sided and apex of the median lobe triangular ( Fig. 17 ).

Biology. Adults of
L . marginata
have been collected on mesquite flowers (
Prosopis
L., Fabaceae ) and
Senegalia greggii (A. Gray) Britton and Rose
( Fabaceae ).
Distribution. Arizona and Texas , USA and Sonora , Mexico ( Fig. 26 ).

Material Examined in Addition to Type Specimens. ARIZONA .
